column5: Yes I know this is a bit tardy, worth a look at brave maritime people, just like you.   http://forum.woodenboat.com/showthread.php?136581-BoatLift-An-Untold-tale-of-September-11-Resilience
Thanks for that. Those are the heros no one hears about.I had no idea.

I had no idea either.  Regular people being heroes.  Amazing that after the call went out...in less that 20 minutes, hundreds of boats responded...the picture was incredible.  500,000 people in less than 9 hours...unbelievable!

I shudder to think what would happen if Simco or Lake O  were to be invaded maybe by the Swiss.  I can see it now.  Musky Mike and Mercman on patrol.  Musky Mike is throwing giant spoons, Mercmans got his army of poms.   :rofl2:  In poor taste, I know
Thanks for sharing that, I didn't know that took place either!
Heartbreaking and uplifting at the same time. Thank you for posting that. As for the "tardiness", it's never too late to be reminded that there are good people in this world.
